												To be honest, I dont really know how it's possible for this game to be still alive.Yea I know I can found max. 200 players playing on official servers (In Europe) and that number tells something (players dont like it) - Why players and I dont like this game?1.) This game has anti-cheat? - WTF??? Where??? Turned off???2.) Marketplace - Yea I love to buy the game and after it just "pay to win" and spend more money like♥♥♥♥♥got3.) Zombies = Terminators - Smashing zombies with baseball bat 11times? (head and upper part) - How can they survive so long? -> Cause they're made of f*ckin steel man!!!4.) Houses interior - Yea  some empty houses with nothing (no chairs, table or some sh!t) - ???5.) Damage of some guns - I dont know but how the f*ck it is possible to shoot someone right into head and not kill (when he's/she's not wearing helmet)6.) Hackers - This game shouts "Buy me to meet some hackers bro!" (No thx I dont need to meet some hackers)7.) Bans - Looks like cheaters are getting banned in like 1year or some bigger delay8.) PTE servers - I like them for stuff farming but you know 99,99% hackers and 0.01% campers and noobs => anti-cheat POWA cant be found here9.) Many bugs, glitches and failed textures - Playing for 2 minutes on PTE server and I found 2+ failed textures and some other fails from developer side10.) Developers - developers say "Everything we need from you is to give us your money and we wont care about game" - Thats said from me cause they arent able to have solid anti-cheat, ban hackers faster, making stupid textures with no collision, they dont care about community.11.) PVP/PVE - please just make 1 ♥♥♥♥in PVE server for people who dont like spraying people with guns like♥♥♥♥♥♥♥for flashlight...My reason why I play this game "Cause Im laughing how terrible it is and how many cheaters, bugs, exploits, failed textures you can find and also dont forget "There's no anti-cheat in-game" (Or Im just blind and anti-cheat is invisible for my account)But still - just "♥♥♥♥IN NOOOOOOOOO" - if you want zombie game buy yourself something better (this game is not worth of 1 dollar or more - I got it for 50cents f*ck yea)

content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												This game was very fun for me for a while then i realized how many people actually do have hacks and esp's. The servers are not well kept and are filled with snipers with aimbots or speed hacks. There is not much to do except collect gear and run through the world and get mad ever time a hacker walks through the wall and kills you. Its only 5 dollars though so if you looking for a cheap way to get really♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥off very quickly then ISS is the game for you. The only up side to all this NOTHING there is no upside. I have a good bit of time on this game and ton's of gear but still its really not all worth it even with a new map there is still nothing to do. The developers really need to get there Sh$$ togeather and fix the real problems before they add things into the game. The Devs are not very nice either. They are very money hungry they took the survival away from the game when they put an in game store into the mix. So if your a hacker or just have money to spare you can just gear up and get all the ammo and armor/meds that you want and never loose. My conclusion to all this ramble is if you want to get a cheap survival game for 5 bucks please please please dont buy this one i can assure you it is a huge waist of your time.

content:
Posted: December 26, 2013
												I had fun playing this game but I like to grind and survive. Don't trust the pictures where you see a  lot of people laying out zombies with rifles and such. Ammo, for guns, are weapon specific and incredibly rare and not worth using on zombies. You'll have better luck finding duplicate weapons and emptying it than you will finding a loose magazine.You will spend your first part of the game finding remote spawn points for food, water, and loot and server hopping to other almost empty servers to empty that same spot over and over.Then you'll spend time trying to not get killed by other people as you loot more dangerous areas(airport) where the somewhat good drops are and about 10 million zombies are found...Not a long term game to play, I wouldn't recommend it or expect a friend to play it with me.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 28, 2013
												Great idea, TERRIBLE! execution.This game is truely terrible... It needs to be burned with fire asap.It is/was nothing more then a simple cash grab game... it came out over-hyped, didnt diliver what it promised (had alot of false advertisement, and was removed from steam twice lol).Its a terrible game cashing in on the "zombie" phase that everyone is on atm.I was an original backer of this game and played during early alpha testing, and back then they had an excuse to have a less then good game since its in alpha. It looked promosing.But not much has changed since alpha for the better...-Graphics are nothing to talk about. Looks like some crappy game from 2004 when on max settings.-Audio is terrible.-The physics/game engine is just poor...-Hackers/cheaters galore.-From what i hear, A LOT of legit players are being banned becuase of their crappy ban system (i think a 5yo can find a better way to stop cheaters... Want to know how they stop cheaters? they place items in areas which are impossible to get to, and if you pick up that item you get banned. But its so poorly done, that these items can be picked up through walls or the celing of building if u jump)-Terrible devs, terrible customer supportTo give you mroe insight on this company.I payed $25 for a game in aplha. It was released for $15 on release... (who knew aplha costs more then release!)On top of that, i literally had to fight for WEEKS to get a free copy of the steam version, since i wanted the game on steam...Trying to get a $10 refund was beating a dead horse though...To give you a little more information (btw the game used to be called WarZ)https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Infestation:_Survivor_Stories#Reception"In October 2012 executive producer Sergey Titov referred to spawn campers in The War Z as "♥♥♥♥♥♥s" in a forum post"their PR team teird to cover for him and say, o he isnt against homosexuality... but he couldnt come out and say it >.>Remember that is the EXECUTIVE PRODUCER! not just some lowely low wage employee or forum mod or something...That would be like the CEO of walmart calling african americans the N word... how much would u respect them if they did something like that?....The list goes on, and im sure there is WAY more not being listed on this wiki.Also know "PCPowerplay gave the game a zero (out of ten), the only zero in the magazine's history"the game is only $15, maybe less if on sale. ya its not much money, and im sure you may get a few dollars worth of cheap fun from the game.BUT i would NOT suggest supporting these kind of developers or companies with even a SINGLE PENNY!

Posted: December 30, 2014
												My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.' Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. To this day, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

content:
Posted: October 25, 2014
												My wife and I have spend hours on this game, several hundred dollars only to be let down over and over. This game has the potential to be so much more but with poor management this game has sunk beyond what any words could really say. The pvp aspect of the game sucks because you might end up being ganked and drop all of your hard earned gear yet at the same time if you want a PVE area you end up having to pay an outrageous price for the "Private" server of theirs then that fully kills the entire MMO part of the game. Seems to me they could do as many MMO's have done and made a pvp system where the game has spots that are contested or something or have PVE servers that allow you to enjoy the game. I am now holding off on putting any more life into this game and waiting on H1Z1 from Sony. ISS had great potential yet they let it fail....

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 14, 2014
												The WarZ or... "Infestation: Survivor Stories" (Renamed because WarZ are infamous for some of the stupid and wrong things they have done so they're tricking you by changing the title.)I picked it up for a buck, still not worth it. The devs for this game are just downright sickening in their treatment of players, they have thretened to blacklist their credit cards, they have thretened lawsuits against people who critisized the game, they're pathedic and I feel terrible for supporting them, even if it is just with one dollar, but that's another dollar that's lining these greedy, lying scumbags' pockets. Cons:1.) They lie on the recomended system requirements, I run a machine slightly better than those and no, 1-5 FPS is not acceptable2.) The options menu is absolutly terrible, Terraria has a better options menu and It's a 2D sidescroller3.) The zombies are ridiculously overpowered, they run faster, they do insane amounts of damage and infect you, and unless you have quite a bit of money on you, you have to pay to cure your character4.) I paid for the title and now you want me to go "Premium" for no extra content, only free weapons and lower teir currency... money grabbing slimeballs5.) The game's absolutly full of hackers, I mean, ridiculously full of hackers.6.) The doesn't allow you to customize a render distance7.) The game boasts features it doesn't even have yet8.) The game changed their name to "infestation: survivor stories" But the devs were too lazy to rename the gamefiles so it's listed as "The War Z" 9.) Instead of giving us a large map they gave us a decant sized map and made the player slow as all hell, lazy, lazy devs.Pros:1.) They have quite a few resolutions however, if you have one of the larger moniters (IE that 2000x???? resolution) You're fresh out of luck.2.) When it isn't spazzing out, flickering, clipping through objects and dropping your framerate to downright ridiculous numbers some of the effects look like a moderately pretty PS2 title... (oh that's not what they were going for?)3.)...That's about it... yea, To wrap it up:The devs are corrupt, sneaky ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s, and don't get me wrong, I usually have the upmost respect for the devs however this? No... Your title is unfit for purpose, this game is a scam, they lie about quite a few features of the game, most of those aren't even implimented while others are just downright broken when they are in, the gameplay is tedious and frustrating and it's just a downright terrible title. Save yourselves the trouble and go buy the Arma II collection or the DayZ standalone if you're looking for a zombie survival horror post apocalyptic-y game. This is not worth your time and certainly not worth mine.

												My wife and I have spend hours on this game, several hundred dollars only to be let down over and over. This game has the potential to be so much more but with poor management this game has sunk beyond what any words could really say. The pvp aspect of the game sucks because you might end up being ganked and drop all of your hard earned gear yet at the same time if you want a PVE area you end up having to pay an outrageous price for the "Private" server of theirs then that fully kills the entire MMO part of the game. Seems to me they could do as many MMO's have done and made a pvp system where the game has spots that are contested or something or have PVE servers that allow you to enjoy the game. I am now holding off on putting any more life into this game and waiting on H1Z1 from Sony. ISS had great potential yet they let it fail....

content:
Posted: March 14, 2014
												The WarZ or... "Infestation: Survivor Stories" (Renamed because WarZ are infamous for some of the stupid and wrong things they have done so they're tricking you by changing the title.)I picked it up for a buck, still not worth it. The devs for this game are just downright sickening in their treatment of players, they have thretened to blacklist their credit cards, they have thretened lawsuits against people who critisized the game, they're pathedic and I feel terrible for supporting them, even if it is just with one dollar, but that's another dollar that's lining these greedy, lying scumbags' pockets. Cons:1.) They lie on the recomended system requirements, I run a machine slightly better than those and no, 1-5 FPS is not acceptable2.) The options menu is absolutly terrible, Terraria has a better options menu and It's a 2D sidescroller3.) The zombies are ridiculously overpowered, they run faster, they do insane amounts of damage and infect you, and unless you have quite a bit of money on you, you have to pay to cure your character4.) I paid for the title and now you want me to go "Premium" for no extra content, only free weapons and lower teir currency... money grabbing slimeballs5.) The game's absolutly full of hackers, I mean, ridiculously full of hackers.6.) The doesn't allow you to customize a render distance7.) The game boasts features it doesn't even have yet8.) The game changed their name to "infestation: survivor stories" But the devs were too lazy to rename the gamefiles so it's listed as "The War Z" 9.) Instead of giving us a large map they gave us a decant sized map and made the player slow as all hell, lazy, lazy devs.Pros:1.) They have quite a few resolutions however, if you have one of the larger moniters (IE that 2000x???? resolution) You're fresh out of luck.2.) When it isn't spazzing out, flickering, clipping through objects and dropping your framerate to downright ridiculous numbers some of the effects look like a moderately pretty PS2 title... (oh that's not what they were going for?)3.)...That's about it... yea, To wrap it up:The devs are corrupt, sneaky ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s, and don't get me wrong, I usually have the upmost respect for the devs however this? No... Your title is unfit for purpose, this game is a scam, they lie about quite a few features of the game, most of those aren't even implimented while others are just downright broken when they are in, the gameplay is tedious and frustrating and it's just a downright terrible title. Save yourselves the trouble and go buy the Arma II collection or the DayZ standalone if you're looking for a zombie survival horror post apocalyptic-y game. This is not worth your time and certainly not worth mine.

												Wow, dont you hate this game? I'm so glad that I only paid 1.99 dollars....I wouldn't invest in this game, based on so many things. I know after reading the reviews I should not have bought it. I mean first time playing, hit by a zombie like maybe 3 time at night, and I was dead. Then I thought well let me just jump back in I won't make the same mistake. Oh you can get back in... about 8 minutes or pay to revive him. EIGHT FRIGGEN MINUTES!?!?! WTF IS THAT? Ok now I get back in, I decided that I would find at least a melee weapon, and I find a barn, run inside, find a golf club, grab it, and three zombies from all the open doors corner me. I killed two trying to get out, and as I exit , one zombie kills me with one swipe. Do you think I wait for another eight minutes....F*#@k no!!Come on guys(developers) are you sure this was your goal to create a game? I think this is a make the money off as many gamers as possible and run (abandon) it. I feel like I've been lied to. This is not even an early release..this is a rip off!!!!!!!Do not waste one single penny!!!!!!!!! Its worthless..worst game I've ever played. I repeat DO NOT GIVE YOUR MONEY AWAY TO PEOPLE THAT NO NOTHING ABOUT GAMING!!

												I bought this game awhile back when it was on sale for $3.74 and to be honest that was the worst waste of money in my life. This game is really horrid. They try to make fixes but don't fix the main issues. They charge real money to get ammo or anything of the sort. Sure some stuff is easy enough to obtain if you don't get randomly skull crushed by a flash light. The only good thing that I thought this game did was they actually made the zombies slow. Personally the Walking Dead Survival Instinct is a better game than this one. Their both garbage, but at least the WD has a little bit of a story and the controls are slightly better. Really this game should just be a free to play; then maybe they could get more customers and make improvements.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 1, 2014
												I can honestly say that I've spent enough time with this game to know that this was definitley some straight up BS. I was there when they called this game a cash grab. I was there when the hacking started. For a while, I defended this game hoping it would get better with time. NOPE. Not only did this steamy pile get worse, but the Devs never showed any kind of concern or attempts to even try to correct any of the the issues that made this game THE WORSE game that I have ever played in my entire life. The only reason I got up to over 100 hours in this game was because I had a few buddies to help me "make" it fun. Youll have more fun playing tetris with no fingers. The zombies were horrible and bugged tf out, the map (s) horrible and bugged tf out. I remember a few times I died because I walked down a mountain the wrong angle. Didnt fall, just died out of nowhere. Had a couple of ok shootouts but those only happend once every blue moon. All the other times were aimbotters. You know who won those fights. People that can see you from half way across the map and probably further just lock on to. I just dont even understand how this game is still allowed on Steam at all. I remeber when it was taken off but how tf did it get back? I would rather see Pong take its place on here. Not even an updated version the original one witha square ball and all.This game should have been canned when the head dev fled the some what failed project. I say somewhat because atleast he got away with a lot of peoples money. The only thing I can say positive about this game is that its 4.99. I feel thats even too much for this. If you're truly considering buying this. Wait until it goes free to play. I can no longer play it and not even by choice. I was also one of the many hopeful suckers who purchased the early access, so that should tell you something. I feel like this sorry excuse for a game was made by my local drug dealers in crack house with an IBM running Windows 90 or something. Dont waist you money on this...youll be happy you didnt. Even if your curious like me and decide to purchase it anyway atleast your not buying it for the original price///

content:
Posted: March 15, 2014
												Wow, dont you hate this game? I'm so glad that I only paid 1.99 dollars....I wouldn't invest in this game, based on so many things. I know after reading the reviews I should not have bought it. I mean first time playing, hit by a zombie like maybe 3 time at night, and I was dead. Then I thought well let me just jump back in I won't make the same mistake. Oh you can get back in... about 8 minutes or pay to revive him. EIGHT FRIGGEN MINUTES!?!?! WTF IS THAT? Ok now I get back in, I decided that I would find at least a melee weapon, and I find a barn, run inside, find a golf club, grab it, and three zombies from all the open doors corner me. I killed two trying to get out, and as I exit , one zombie kills me with one swipe. Do you think I wait for another eight minutes....F*#@k no!!Come on guys(developers) are you sure this was your goal to create a game? I think this is a make the money off as many gamers as possible and run (abandon) it. I feel like I've been lied to. This is not even an early release..this is a rip off!!!!!!!Do not waste one single penny!!!!!!!!! Its worthless..worst game I've ever played. 												I bought this game awhile back when it was on sale for $3.74 and to be honest that was the worst waste of money in my life. This game is really horrid. They try to make fixes but don't fix the main issues. They charge real money to get ammo or anything of the sort. Sure some stuff is easy enough to obtain if you don't get randomly skull crushed by a flash light. The only good thing that I thought this game did was they actually made the zombies slow. That was it! The controls are clunky the weapon collsion with the zombies is horrible. I mean when I hit a zombie with a hammer or with a boat oar their head should♥♥♥♥♥♥back a little. Personally the Walking Dead Survival Instinct is a better game than this one. Their both garbage, but at least the WD has a little bit of a story and the controls are slightly better. Really this game should just be a free to play; then maybe they could get more customers and make improvements.

												PVP deathmatch - no progression. You lose all your hard earned gear and items on death. Zombies are there just like trees and rocks and don't matter much to all the KOS (kill on sight) players. There are no PVE servers nor is there anyway to turn off PVP. number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 8, 2013
												I will keep this review brief, though i feel for this game it is a public service that needs to be done. Stay away from this game, you dont want it. Most people are aware of the terribly scammy practices Hammerpoint Interactive has engaged in, but for everyone one who knows there may very well be 100 who dont know.So, i'm gonna just run down the list in no particular order: Dedicated servers were promised, and that promise was not delivered upon. Enforcement of game rules and punishment of cheaters was also promised, yet there are plenty of people who use wallhacks/ aimbot (and I'm far from trigger-happy when it comes to accusing people of such things, because I fully realize that there are people who are better than me at videogames).A significantly larger amount of player slots per server was promised, compared to the less-than-128player-servers we currently have.And the real big one that grinds my gears? The game was originally advertised as being totally free to play with the purchasable items being cosmetic. this is something that they refuse to enact in practice, as you can buy all sorts of spiffy backpacks, guns, and blades (rentals too, of course) and some of these weapons can never be found in game, as well as being vastly stronger than their non cash-shop weapons.in short, a scam by any other name is still a scam.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 3, 2014
												There are no ordinary zombies... Instead of throwing themselves at you with tooth and claw, these mean sum'♥♥♥♥♥es fly into an epilectic fit of rage and use their telekinetic mastery to end you without even touching.There are no ordinary players... Instead of A-holes holding you up or killing you for your goods, many of these guys don only the finest invisibilty cloaks, making nothing but their backpack and flashlight visible before beating you mercilessly with it (The torch, not the backpack. I think). These are no ordinary micro-transactions... Instead of being the alternative of infinite-houred grinding, the MT's make you pay for pointless misc's that you'll use or lose within moments (Ah, Capitalism).These are no ordinary physics... Instead of fall damage happening after large drops, or being able to climb up onto cars for protection, or... just... just ♥♥♥♥ all that. Die from jumping down a stair, let the telekinetic zombies just kill you through anything, just anything that makes things more frustrating.WarZ (Oops, sorry Dev's), all jokes aside, is a ♥♥♥♥ing mess. Besides what I've mensioned there's graphics, controversy, loot, weapons etc that all stink. Stear clear.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 6, 2014
												I brought Infestation: Survival Stories back when it was known as The Warz i got the pleasure of taking part in the alpha stage of the game which was freaking awesome there was always that surprise of coming across another player and having the choice of if you should partner up or take him/her down and scavange for the loot they drop but as time went on the game suddenly started to loose its way due to the fact that theres still only 2 maps and even with the Fairfight Anti-Hack System theres still tons and i mean TONS of hackers still in this game using aimbots and esp which takes all the fun out of this game pretty much 90% of this game has hackers on every server and even if they get banned they just buy a new account as the price of the game is dirt cheap. Pros+ Hours Spent Playing+ Zombies+ PVP+ Clans / Groups+ Map SizesCons- Anti Hack System (Need a Better One)- Aimbot & ESP- No New Maps- Devs Shouldnt Have Left Alpha EarlyOverall Score: 2 / 10

content:
Posted: November 8, 2014
												Absolute garbage. I can't believe I believed my friends when they picked this up. Glitchy, poor animations, and much slower and incomplete than DayZ. Zombies are difficult to kill, and not because of their abilities, amount of health, or movement - but because of poor hit detection, hit radius, and other aspects that were poorly programmed (The animations and hit registration don't match up aesthetically) You clip on objects that you shouldn't clip on, and don't clip through things you would think would stop you. Don't waste your money, even if it's $2.67. Edit: Furthermore, I recently went back to try and give it a second chance, since I had already given the developer my money, and found out that I was permabanned for this comment. Now they have my money and have technically robbed me of the experience (or lack-there-of) that I paid for.They've refused to respond to my tickets. Spiteful, poor development, etc. I honestly don't wish negative things on people or businesses often, but their product and business practices have convinced me that these people don't deserve jobs in product development and I hope reading this will deter as many purchasers as possible to prevent this developer from getting any further. They already believe they're immune to proper practices, clearly, and if they gather enough money they'll just be in the position they want to be in: too big to fail. Vote with your money, and put your vote somewhere that it will count (Which is definitely not in infestation survivor stories)

number of helpful: 6 of 9 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 6, 2013
												So I had put off buying this game due to all the horrible reviews, metacritic rating, and the fact the developers basically p*ssed all over loyal players/paying supports of previous games(War Inc) but I desided to give it a shot anyway since it was on sale for $3. Let me start by saying most of the horrible reviews are true.-Graphics?Low quality and poorly optimzied. That means it's not super pretty but still runs slowly.-Sound?Your own SFX(footsteps, splashing,etc..) are way too loud if you have SFX set to a level so they actually help you detect threats. Sound also doesn't seem to be optimized properlly. Locating something by sound is hit or miss.-World?The map is very large. With lots of locations to explore. It would probably take near an hour to walk from one corner to the other. That's great but it can be VERY inconvient is there is no quick travel or selective spawning. But ultimatly there is still only one map. There also aren't that many building models and you will see things reused a lot.-GamePlayExploring, avoiding zombies, collecting supplies. All fun. Ranged combat is fairly tuned as it was ported directly from War Inc. Melee combat is horribly simple and poorly done on top. Zombie AI is horrible. They get stuck. Can't climb anything over 2ft.-Community?The game has a fairly large community that usually fills a couple of the 100 player servers constantly with lots of smaller servers as well. However, the majority of those players have a kill on sight attitude. Youre not likely to make many friends you didn't bring with you.-Grouping?There is a basic group system which allows group chat and disables "friendly fire." There is no easy way to simply join and play with your friends. Due to the prementioned huge map and random spawning it's very likely that you will join a server and be near the people you actually want ro play with.-Pay to Win?Yes. The game is Buy to Play and Pay to Win. Supplies(food, water,bullets) are not easy to come by in game but for a couple of dollars you can easily stock up on what would other wise take several hours to gather if youre lucky.-Fun?Strange but Yes. The game is FAR from polished but if the stars align and you manage to meet up with your friend(s) on an low-medium populated server there is much fun to be had from the sandbox elements combined with lite PvP. -Recommend?I would recommend buying this game. On sale. Don't spend over $5. Sure it can be fun but it's the type of fun you would expect from a low budget indie game, which Infestation is not. There are just to many things wrong and the developers can not be trusted to give the game longevity or proper support(see War Inc.)

content:
Posted: October 28, 2014
												Ehmmmmmmm. How about just NO. I have spend about 2.5 hours just trying to connect to any server to play. After that i actually got in a server and played about 20 mins. First of all Im in Europe but the game decides I should connect to a US server in quick join. After I spawn in, I ran around in the woods for about 5 mins but there was not 1 zombie to be seen. As far as my experience goes, zombies are only in the towns. As I ran into a town, I encountered a zombie. The only thing they start you with is a flashlight and some food and banage. I spend about 2-3 mins punching the same zombie just to kill it. I have picked up a gun and tried to use it. There was no animation what so ever when you shoot it, it only bounds your screen up a little. This is the point when i decided to quit the game and say...... just NO. I would recommend staying as far away from this game as possible. But if you looking for the worst game I strongly recommend this.

content:
Posted: December 11, 2016
												I played this before it came to steam and then a little after it released to steam. I CAN NOT recommend this game to anyone. I payed 20 bucks for their "pioneer" pack back when they were still in beta. I would suggest you stay away from this game and/or anything this company/developers make. The whole things feels like a cash grab. I was banned early on during the beta for no reason, I was using a tree for cover when someone killed me and said I was cheating.... I was banned shortly after. either way, there are MUCH better survivals out with DayZ and all the others that came out in 2016.To my knowledge no other survival game charges you to revive so you can play again after you die. I completely understand the microtransactions for cosmetics but if you're going to charge me to play after I died... no thanks.. feels like something from a mobile game (pay for energy to continue playing)just spend your money on something else, there are plenty of other survivals that are MUCH better

content:
Posted: April 2, 2014
												Best experience ever! I approached the supermarket, starving and willing to devour any scrap leftover. I noticed a granola bar, and I became filled with joy and relief. Suddenly, a floating construction hat came into view at the end of the aisle. I stared, wondering if I was going insane, or if my hunger was really this bad. The strange emptiness was holding something, a flashlight. It approached me, raised the flashlight, and brought it down on my head with titan- force, leaving nothing but bloody, bruised, and mushy flesh. I collapsed, embracing death's cold grip. The last thing I saw was that thing eating MY granola bar. 10/2 wuld bang.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 29, 2015
												After a year or so of not playing I decided to take it upon myself and see how the game has changed in the many months of  not playing, despite the other reviews and flack this game has been getting I decided to power through it and go with "Oh, hey it's probably not that bad." you know, the stages of denial, sadly though I probably should have listened, it took me two hours to download the game cause of my internet being crappy (sorry), but finally it had finished, and I could play with my friend on Infestation, only to find out that in the year and a half of not touching the game that I had been permanently banned by fairfight, now, I have experience with fairfight, and it's instability, but to my knowledge it also runs Punkbuster an anti-hack I am quite familiar with, sadly though it seems I am hacking or cheating for not even doing anything, quite literally, so, sadly I cannot make a second review however I will say this, no one had gotten back to me, or even was able to answer my questions pertaining to the ban instead that it was "justified", now for all you I must say that you should listen to the other reviewers, and heed their words carefully, cause this problem has been there supposedly for QUITE A LONG TIME...I mean if you are to get banned or suspended due to suspicious activity for playing the game fairly while there are legitimate hackers still playing obviously the developers prefer their sales more then their community or declining fanbase, also hammerpoint if you actually care to read for a change, that is a horrible business model, just saying, I mean lest I remember the game had functioning zombies so that was okay I guess and they had a working detection radius besides DayZ, so yeah, but that's not giving it any real credit, I mean, the graphics are to be desired, I played Morrowind again after a LONG TIME and that looked better graphically ((I'm not even joking)), and mechanics wise it handles like any other static third person shooter, heavens Syphon Filter Omega Strain was better mechanically and control wise in comparison and that is an OLD PS2 game, ouch, too the root of the point, there are many other games, even ORIGINAL NINTENDO games that were better in comparison, so I guess that's a wrap -sighs- this game was far better when it FIRST came out, like it's early alpha days, but bugs that also sucked the fun out but hey it was ALPHA, so that was excusable, but yeah, I will say this here and now, save yourself the impending migrane, and DO NOT, I say it again DO NOT buy this game, or play it, if you want a game that functions well enough, and has developers whom care more about the game and it's community rather than it's money, than look no further than DayZ, the Standalone.::EDIT::Recently found out my friend had been banned too from out of the blue as well and he just bought a fresh copy... Okay I've been composed about this but not anymore, f**k this game, f**k the company that runs it, f**k the broken anti-hack they supposedly have, and f**k the developers and moderators, like seriously play the game fairly you get banned, hack and you stay on, honestly this has to be the worst game developement team, right beside LJN, you know the company that made those crappy Atari games back in the 1980's? yeah, right beside them... f**k them both...Steam, for good god, do EVERYONE a large favor, remove this game from your shelves, I mean from what I see this game has a HORRIBLE, I mean absolutely atrocious meta score, and the reviews are spot on about how much it sucks, even it's positive reviews are even negative in it's rite to be funny which quite a few of them are, but seriously remove Infestation again, and keep it that way, no need to infect your servers with this bile...

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 14, 2014
												Everyone should buy this game. Not to necessarily install and play, but to own the worst mmo in the history of gaming. It would be safe to say this will remain the worst mmo in my entire life. The time and effort spent to make this game would have been better spent playing games to understand what might make one fun. It is a great concept, a mmo based around zombies, raiding other players for supplies. I believe if they reduced the respawn time,  and balance weapons such that anyone might have some kind of chance, the game could possibly be a little fun anyhow. graphic arent great, but would serve their purpose. It just comes down to promising to take your kids you disney world, but instead taking them mcdonalds playland. I am not even sure you would like it if it was the first and only game you have played. There are hugely epic mmos and great zombie games, and this is neither. I hope the two come together, forming survival parties, going through ruins looking for supplies and avoiding, or killing zombies would be lots of fun.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 15, 2014
												I feel it's a bit early to write a review since I haven't spent too much time with this game.  But, I will update the review as I play ( hopefully ).The pros so far :The maps are huge.  And they are full of buildings, houses, etc, all enterable.Zombies seem to work both from sound and line or sight, which makes them feel threatening.Zombies aren't easy to kill.  Zombies have to be shot/axed/etc to the head, otherwise they just keep coming, I like this.Skill based system that allows for advancement as you survive and do things like kill zombies.The game looks very good ( graphics ).The cons:When you die, you lose everything you had in your backpack.When you do die, if you have nothing in your global vault, it can be EXTREMELY difficult to survive.Areas that allows for global storage are much to far apart, making it EXTREMELY boring to have to run back and forth just to store things so you don't lose everything when you die.If they ever removed the mechanic which makes you lose EVERYTHING when you die, this would be a GREAT game.  Otherwise it feels like a game that sort of tricks players into buying cash shop items through the player vs player mechanics.The pvp aspect of this game, and losing all looted items, is really just a cash shop trick to get players to spend real money.  The cash shop offers safes to put items in, so players can hide away items from being looted when they are killed.  It's unfortunate that the pvp is in place to get players to spend real money.

content:
Posted: January 29, 2014
												Infestation Survivor Stories or AKA Warz. The popular game that has driven many dayz fans crazy but in the bad way because of its many uses of copyright kinda of shiz and blah blah blah. Okay on to the point, Warz as i like to call it , is a seriously bad game to play alone. Not only will u DIE alone but the fact that u bring items from ur GI( Global Inventory ) is being wasted every single time u bring it out but its even more painful to see it being robbed from u , also raging. This game is not recommended at a price of $15 but when a sale comes out, now that is worth because its only $3 and hopefully this game might actually go free but hey it might happen when the developers go desperate. The mechanics of this "wonderful" game is seriously easy. I am not kidding it really is easier then dayz. So i would only say that if you want a easier game other then dayz then feel free to get this cause it really is easy. All u ever do in this game is just roam around, kill zombies , kill people, get their loot and run. Thats it and that just pretty much summarised the game. Playing this with friends well unless your truly commited to a clan game like this where you have to be in groups in other to win most fights is really fun. Yes of course the raging and the ♥♥♥♥♥ing and all that kind of things will happen but it really is fun when u are actually suffering this with ur friends. So on that note, ISS or WarZ not really recommended because of alot of bugs, hackers and more experienced players but it is fun with friends and its kinda cheap.

content:
Posted: June 18, 2013
												This game is...genocide! This is my review of this "game".-----GOOD STUPH-----* The map is quite detailed, even though some pieces of grass or moss clip through the walls at some places. The spawn points for weapons are well placed.* There are...hats?-----BAD STUPH-----* The graphics are hideous, the textures are blurry and the trees look like fuzzed up, green pine cones. The animations are bad and the performance is THE worst I've ever seen in a videogame.* Vehicles are badly made and are almost useless. They break easily and can get blocked by zombies unless you are moving at a high speeds.* (Almost) Forced Player Versus Player, there are no people in this game that will let you live. If you see someone, you must either shoot that person or run away unless you want to get killed and lose all your items.-----FINAL THOUGHS-----The game is freaking terrible, as it is obviously a big cashgrab. You should stay away from this game unless you want to get a glitchy game to make funny gameplay montage from it.Simply, don't buy this game. Don't do it. STOP IT!!! Too late...//Max Game - Zombie food

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 29, 2015
												After a year or so of not playing I decided to take it upon myself and see how the game has changed in the many months of  not playing, despite the other reviews and flack this game has been getting I decided to power through it and go with "Oh, hey it's probably not that bad." you know, the stages of denial, sadly though I probably should have listened, it took me two hours to download the game cause of my internet being crappy (sorry), but finally it had finished, and I could play with my friend on Infestation, only to find out that in the year and a half of not touching the game that I had been permanently banned by fairfight, now, I have experience with fairfight, and it's instability, but to my knowledge it also runs Punkbuster an anti-hack I am quite familiar with, sadly though it seems I am hacking or cheating for not even doing anything, quite literally, so, sadly I cannot make a second review however I will say this, no one had gotten back to me, or even was able to answer my questions pertaining to the ban instead that it was "justified", now for all you I must say that you should listen to the other reviewers, and heed their words carefully, cause this problem has been there supposedly for QUITE A LONG TIME...I mean if you are to get banned or suspended due to suspicious activity for playing the game fairly while there are legitimate hackers still playing obviously the developers prefer their sales more then their community or declining fanbase, also hammerpoint if you actually care to read for a change, that is a horrible business model, just saying, I mean lest I remember the game had functioning zombies so that was okay I guess and they had a working detection radius besides DayZ, so yeah, but that's not giving it any real credit, I mean, the graphics are to be desired, I played Morrowind again after a LONG TIME and that looked better graphically ((I'm not even joking)), and mechanics wise it handles like any other static third person shooter, heavens Syphon Filter Omega Strain was better mechanically and control wise in comparison and that is an OLD PS2 game, ouch, too the root of the point, there are many other games, even ORIGINAL NINTENDO games that were better in comparison, so I guess that's a wrap -sighs- this game was far better when it FIRST came out, like it's early alpha days, but bugs that also sucked the fun out but hey it was ALPHA, so that was excusable, but yeah, I will say this here and now, save yourself the impending migrane, and DO NOT, I say it again DO NOT buy this game, or play it, if you want a game that functions well enough, and has developers whom care more about the game and it's community rather than it's money, than look no further than DayZ, the Standalone.::EDIT::Recently found out my friend had been banned too from out of the blue as well and he just bought a fresh copy... Okay I've been composed about this but not anymore, f**k this game, f**k the company that runs it, f**k the broken anti-hack they supposedly have, and f**k the developers and moderators, like seriously play the game fairly you get banned, hack and you stay on, honestly this has to be the worst game developement team, right beside LJN, you know the company that made those crappy Atari games back in the 1980's? yeah, right beside them... f**k them both...Steam, for good god, do EVERYONE a large favor, remove this game from your shelves, I mean from what I see this game has a HORRIBLE, I mean absolutely atrocious meta score, and the reviews are spot on about how much it sucks, even it's positive reviews are even negative in it's rite to be funny which quite a few of them are, but seriously remove Infestation again, and keep it that way, no need to infect your servers with this bile...

content:
Posted: April 2, 2014
												Best experience ever! I approached the supermarket, starving and willing to devour any scrap leftover. I noticed a granola bar, and I became filled with joy and relief. Suddenly, a floating construction hat came into view at the end of the aisle. I stared, wondering if I was going insane, or if my hunger was really this bad. The strange emptiness was holding something, a flashlight. It approached me, raised the flashlight, and brought it down on my head with titan- force, leaving nothing but bloody, bruised, and mushy flesh. I collapsed, embracing death's cold grip. The last thing I saw was that thing eating MY granola bar. 10/2 wuld bang.

												I don't see how anyone could hate this game... here are some pros:- The game only crashes every two hours- The game is a pay to win (gotta pay if you want to respawn, or you'll have to wait an hour)- The chances of you getting banned are totally random so there isn't much risk if you're a hacker- Almost half of your deaths can be from hackers- Your fps might drop if you go into cities, but who cares? the risk is worth finding a chemlight- With real money, you can buy any item you want from the in-game store- The loading screen is only 5-10 minutes long.- Last time i played, the hunger and thirst meters didn't even work, so don't worry about keeping them up.- ps hit me up if you want me to update the list with anymore information.

content:
Posted: December 20, 2014
												OK, so I started watching a few vid of Frankie on a Dayz mod of Arma 2.  Thought it was cool and bought the game, it was really hard to get on a server.  Then I found out about WARZ.  This was good because you could actually melee a zombie.  Then I found weapons and ammo and other goodies.  It was hard to find these items and everyone seemed to be paying before I did.  Ran into a few players and learned the hard way, not to trust people.  Later on I gave the benefit of a doubt and trust and got killed for it.  New maps vehicles added. and now Caliwood.  Over all, I like this game, it soothes my zombie craving.  I have to learn to be a better PVP player.  So used to console games not used to the PC style and controls.  I give this gamea  8 or of 10 .  With hackers on, I would give this game a 4 out of 10.   Get ride of these guys.  What's the point in aimbot?  where's the challenge?  I suck at PVP, but I don't cheat.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												Totally NOT worth the $3.74 price tag, it's not even worthy of the $1.99 Daily deal that had passed. Infestation: Survivor Stories, or WarZ is a cheap recreation of DayZ that had been done in-order to try and leech off the successful sales of it's competitors. The game features very poorly worked on codes and excessive and frustrating, sometimes game-breaking glitches/bugs.Pros:1. Is a great way to work up a rage-enducing therapy.2. Can be gifted to someone you absolutely despise3. Relatively cheap, and can be used to farm some Steam XPCons:1. Excessive number of upseting, and game-breaking bugs/glitches2. Greedy Microtransaction system that requires you to either wait 20 minutes to play, or pay $5.00 to play then.3. Coding is poorly done, making it easily manipulated, and therefore a Security Risk.4. A developer whom worked on this game, also developed Big Rigs: Off the Road racing, google it.5. The entire game itself is a Scam.But don't just take my word for it, read the many other reviews for this game and look into this game, perhaps it may just pique your interest, although I greatly doubt that this game has a long life-span left.

content:
Posted: October 21, 2016
												I have 287 games in my Steam library as of the moment I'm writing this. Most of them I love, like or just plain enjoy, while others are what you would concider "mishap purchases". There has been only one time, however, when I've felt so disgusted, and betrayed by my, albeit a bit naïve, purchase of this game. Zombie survival games where the "♥♥♥♥♥♥quot;. Everyone and their grandmothers were playing DayZ! Let's make a game that capitalizes on that! Let's lie to our audience. Let's turn  guns and ammo into micro-transactions. Let's create no-kill zones with only on entry/exit point that people can camp outside of, killing people as the go outside.I'm proud to say that this game no longer tarnishes my Steam library with it's filth, as I personally contacted Steam support to have them permanently remove this game without a refund.These games are cancer. (I should now... And I still played ARK...)

												I don't see how anyone could hate this game... here are some pros:- The game only crashes every two hours- The game is a pay to win (gotta pay if you want to respawn, or you'll have to wait an hour)- The chances of you getting banned are totally random so there isn't much risk if you're a hacker- Almost half of your deaths can be from hackers- Your fps might drop if you go into cities, but who cares? the risk is worth finding a chemlight- With real money, you can buy any item you want from the in-game store- The loading screen is only 5-10 minutes long.- Last time i played, the hunger and thirst meters didn't even work, so don't worry about keeping them up.- ps hit me up if you want me to update the list with anymore information.

content:
Posted: February 22
Product received for free
WarningI rewrote this after my intial review was missing. Prob due to the game changing names again. This game comes in many foul flavors such as WarZ, Infestation Surviver Stories (now classic wtf?), Romero's Aftermath (because WarZ/ISS was so bad lets do it again with less microtransactions), Infestation World (we couldn't even this this on Steam), Infestation The New Z (same game with improved business model), Shattered Skies (same game but in a space theme and no micro transactions), Last Man Standing (poor copy H1Z1 KotK and The Culling). All of these unfinished games use many of the same assets, and are on the same graphically handicapped engine. Some of the titles are almost exactly the same game.  Expect game breaking bugs, hackers, bad graphics, and poor performance. Pay MeThe game has the absolute worst micro transactions I have ever seen in a game. Pay real money to respawn... F*%@ no! Buy cosmetic items with real money just to be looted and taken by other players... WTF? Buy weapons and ammo with real money to kill the spawn camper when you pay me real money to respawn... Get the picture?  The last two titles (Shattered Skies and Last Man Standing) at least have done away with the micro transactions for the moment. ConclusionBe cautious of anything these guys develope/produce: OP Productions and Free Reign Entertainment, both companies founded by Sergey Titov, a man credited for making one of the worst games ever, Big Rigs: Over the Road Racing (2003).

A Video of Infestation: Survivor Stories Classic

			This is my first thoughts on Infestation after receiving it as a gift from Turtlemaw on Twitch TV. Thanks for the game. I just hope they make some very needed improvements.		





Aftermath - After I$$ (WarZ) 
A Video of Aftermath
By: Volt

			This is a video of Romero's Aftermath. The successor to Infestation: Survivor Stories formally known as WarZ. ISS had the worst business model I have ever seen in a game but Aftermath didn't fall too far from the tree.

WarningI rewrote this after my intial review was missing. Prob due to the game changing names again. This game comes in many foul flavors such as WarZ, Infestation Surviver Stories (now classic wtf?), Romero's Aftermath (because WarZ/ISS was so bad lets do it again with less microtransactions), Infestation World (we couldn't even this this on Steam), Infestation The New Z (same game with improved business model), Shattered Skies (same game but in a space theme and no micro transactions), Last Man Standing (poor copy H1Z1 KotK and The Culling). All of these unfinished games use many of the same assets, and are on the same graphically handicapped engine. Some of the titles are almost exactly the same game.  Expect game breaking bugs, hackers, bad graphics, and poor performance. Pay MeThe game has the absolute worst micro transactions I have ever seen in a game. Pay real money to respawn... F*%@ no! Buy cosmetic items with real money just to be looted and taken by other players... WTF? Buy weapons and ammo with real money to kill the spawn camper when you pay me real money to respawn... Get the picture?  The last two titles (Shattered Skies and Last Man Standing) at least have done away with the micro transactions for the moment. ConclusionBe cautious of anything these guys develope/produce: OP Productions and Free Reign Entertainment, both companies founded by Sergey Titov, a man credited for making one of the worst games ever, Big Rigs: Over the Road Racing (2003).

content:
Posted: December 22, 2013
												The base game is solid if a little over-run with heavy weaponary and equipment. This could be a very smooth and enjoyable game but it is let down by the developers decisions. Eventually they will turn you off the game and cause you regret putting any money into it.I enjoyed the game then I was banned because fairfight said I was a hacker. They would not unban me, I went to other independent bodies and I was unbanned but all my stuff was removed as a last act of spite. This is not a rare story it is the norm for the game and seems to be a case of "If we ban them they'll buy another account". That being said the game is full of hackers so you'll die a lot. The developers have been known to give out the best weapons to their favourites, they ban people who kill their characters in fair fights(see the youtube videos on this. They are in short corrupt and unwilling to do anything other than bleed players dry.They will change the map, make items you purchased and placed on the map unreachable(that you paid money for) and then not give you the items or refund the cost.In short go buy the DayZ standalone and save yourself the hassle. You might get some good gametime out of this game but you will have to be very lucky.

content:
Posted: January 29, 2014
												Infestation Survivor Stories or AKA Warz. The popular game that has driven many dayz fans crazy but in the bad way because of its many uses of copyright kinda of shiz and blah blah blah. Okay on to the point, Warz as i like to call it , is a seriously bad game to play alone. Not only will u DIE alone but the fact that u bring items from ur GI( Global Inventory ) is being wasted every single time u bring it out but its even more painful to see it being robbed from u , also raging. This game is not recommended at a price of $15 but when a sale comes out, now that is worth because its only $3 and hopefully this game might actually go free but hey it might happen when the developers go desperate. The mechanics of this "wonderful" game is seriously easy. I am not kidding it really is easier then dayz. So i would only say that if you want a easier game other then dayz then feel free to get this cause it really is easy. All u ever do in this game is just roam around, kill zombies , kill people, get their loot and run. Thats it and that just pretty much summarised the game. Playing this with friends well unless your truly commited to a clan game like this where you have to be in groups in other to win most fights is really fun. Yes of course the raging and the ♥♥♥♥♥ing and all that kind of things will happen but it really is fun when u are actually suffering this with ur friends. So on that note, ISS or WarZ not really recommended because of alot of bugs, hackers and more experienced players but it is fun with friends and its kinda cheap.

Posted: June 18, 2013
												This game is...genocide! This is my review of this "game".-----GOOD STUPH-----* The map is quite detailed, even though some pieces of grass or moss clip through the walls at some places. The spawn points for weapons are well placed.* There are...hats?-----BAD STUPH-----* The graphics are hideous, the textures are blurry and the trees look like fuzzed up, green pine cones. The animations are bad and the performance is THE worst I've ever seen in a videogame.* Vehicles are badly made and are almost useless. They break easily and can get blocked by zombies unless you are moving at a high speeds.* (Almost) Forced Player Versus Player, there are no people in this game that will let you live. If you see someone, you must either shoot that person or run away unless you want to get killed and lose all your items.-----FINAL THOUGHS-----The game is freaking terrible, as it is obviously a big cashgrab. You should stay away from this game unless you want to get a glitchy game to make funny gameplay montage from it.Simply, don't buy this game. Don't do it. STOP IT!!! Too late...//Max Game - Zombie food

												Honestly this is one of the worst games i've played in my life.  I have played facebook games better than this!  If you get killed it makes you wait 20 minutes for your survivor to be revived, ok now it is a facebook game.  This is supposed to be a zombie survival sim, instead there is an store that you can buy ammo, food and other stuff from. It's so boring its not like Dayz where there is alot of scavenge areas, it's mostly forest and mountains.  The graphics are all right, but the games is just so bad. content:
Posted: January 2, 2014
												I purchased this game during a Steam Summer Sale since I couldn't get the DayZ mod to work on ARMA. Had over 200+ hours of play with this game and had a respectable cache of guns ammo backpacks rare items ect. Then my account was hacked and everything was stolen. Went through proper steps to contact support and hoping support could see my account was accessed from a different IP or something and possibly get my items restored. After 2 MONTHS of waiting on my "pending" ticket, I was told they wouldn't restore my items and was told something to the effect of "all the items that were stolen from you are still available in-game for me to start over and restore what was stolen." SO I'M SUPPOSED TO SPEND ANOTHER 200+ HOURS TO GET MY CACHE BACK??? ♥♥♥♥ THAT AND ♥♥♥♥ YOU customer support. I'm glad Reddit.com and Metecritic.com ripped you apart with their reviews. The game is fun and can be frustrating since it's a PvP which means everyone will KOS you even if you have no gear just to be a prick but dont expect any help from support if something goes wrong. DO. NOT. BUY. THIS. GAME.

												I have 287 games in my Steam library as of the moment I'm writing this. Most of them I love, like or just plain enjoy, while others are what you would concider "mishap purchases". There has been only one time, however, when I've felt so disgusted, and betrayed by my, albeit a bit naïve, purchase of this game. Zombie survival games where the "♥♥♥♥♥♥quot;. Everyone and their grandmothers were playing DayZ! Let's make a game that capitalizes on that! Let's lie to our audience. Let's turn  guns and ammo into micro-transactions. 												I never write reviews, but this time how can I not?I was pretty hyped about this game. Looked fun as hell.Me and my team mate get on to play and honestly if done right, it would be a very fun game.BUTIt is a load of caca instead.The game was made so poorly that even on low settings it will freeze and crash a good computer that can runall other games just fine.When you can get a computer to run it, the servers boot you off without warning every 2-5 minutes. Both of which make the game totally unplayable.Oh and if this game was every fixed, and made into the game it had potential to be, they need a better/more realistic looting system. & the weapons need to be more accurate especially the scopesand my fps ranged from 0 - 20 only! & the item descriptions need to be detailed properly (such as one backpack tells you how many slots it has, while another does not. all items are like that). so that needs to be worked on. Also the griefers are a bit ridiculous.but with all its really bad issues, thats the least of your worries!!!The Devs have obviously said a big F U to the players and I dont see this game ever being fixed. Thats really sad.So many games go this way these days. It has become so bad I am about to stop supporting indie games! How sad is that?

												I bought this game a couple of years ago, it was then released as "WarZ".I was being a fool to myself, having too much hope and expectations for this game, don't blame me - the pictures looked great! It's quite a long time ago since I played this "game", and I wouldn't expect it to change much. As soon as the game was released and started getting bad reviews, the developers thought that it was a good call to change the name into something else, just to keep milking people's wallets... The game sucks and the developers are a disgrace. Do not buy this game!After getting the launcher up, I tried resetting my password, which I couldn't manage. The reasoning of this was the message I got when I entered the mail address that I knew as the correct one, but only got "Message delivery failed..." as a response.The folder that gets created when you install the game does still have the same old name: "The War Z"TL;DR: I just bought this game, only to warn you not to. I didn't want to actually start the game, but I had to... Only to make this review... :(

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 30, 2013
												Pros:-Graphically the game looks good.-Decent Loot in the game is fairly easy to achieve if you know where those spawns are.-The Dynamic Lighting looks great. (SweetFX makes it greater)-Fairly Decent sized open world. (but could use some more fillers to block out the dreaded walking)-Character Customization is neat. (but requires you to have to pay either GC or GD to unlock some which this serves as both a con and pro)-Finding a rare item can be exhilarating at times.-Loot Hoarding is always great. (This is one Key feature why I like Infestation most about)-Having your very own Unlimited GI .(Global Inventory)Cons:-Game has a lot of potential, Devs refuse to maximize that potential.-No matter what the devs tell you about this being a PVE based game is a lie and focuses towards PVP, very hard to keep the loot you find without some Jacka** killing you on sight.-Large FPS drops in certain areas as well as FPS hickups (This happens even on high end computers). Large cities that require a lot of rendering have a lot of FPS drops Campos on v2 being one.-Leveling is fairly slow-This game is pretty hard to play without some sort of GC start up fund as a new player to Infestation. Which I recommend getting at least one of the GC packs otherwise you'll have a hard time with no items in your GI. (Overall isn't fair to have to purchase more to the game to actually enjoy it)-Little options to lower resolution on lower end PC's.-Lots of bugs the community constantly complains about, but never get fixed in patches until far later.-Loads of Punkbuster issues with this game, Some Kicks, Some Temperary false bans, Others like myself getting Computer freezes/Lockups where a hard reset will only work.-People Being Falsely banned. (Supposidly, which really I think is because they have Keyloggers on their PC's)-Development in this game is pretty slow.-Things being promised, but never happen.-Customer Support is god awefully slow.-Developers make up pity excuses, whether it's based on your ban, features, implementations, etc.-False Advertising.-Very limited Zombie Models. (After a while of seeing the same NPC's they get stale real quick)-Animations are very limited and lack (Melee weapons Especially, Same animation over and over)-Lot of Hackers in this game that  have one goal, to kill you unfairly and steal your items and sell their account with your items and many other peoples items for a real profit.Overall:This game has a lot of potential, why the devs hold back, will never know. This game is getting better, but very slowly. The biggest issue in this game are the FPS problems. Owning an Nvidia Geforce GTX 470 GPU and an i7 CPU I should not be getting 5-10 FPS in Large cities, something isn't right. I can't say the devs are a scam, otherwise they'd stop further development of this game, but still doesnt make up the excuse why it's so slow in development. So would I recommend to buy this game? No, however it is enjoyable at times, but with the bugs and issues this game has as well as in the company, a lot needs to be changed before I can give a better review. So I'd wait for a better outcome on this game to be honest, if it gets that far. Don't get me wrong I play this a lot based on hours as you can see, it's just those enjoyable moments as I was saying is why I still play, and the Loot hoarding which is a special feature to have a GI while no other game has done (Besides Nether, but Nether is just as worse as this game don't know why people recommend it over this game I've seen Youtube reviews of the game that were just, bad).

content:
Posted: November 30, 2013
												Pros:-Graphically the game looks good.-Decent Loot in the game is fairly easy to achieve if you know where those spawns are.-The Dynamic Lighting looks great. (SweetFX makes it greater)-Fairly Decent sized open world. (but could use some more fillers to block out the dreaded walking)-Character Customization is neat. (but requires you to have to pay either GC or GD to unlock some which this serves as both a con and pro)-Finding a rare item can be exhilarating at times.-Loot Hoarding is always great. (This is one Key feature why I like Infestation most about)-Having your very own Unlimited GI .(Global Inventory)Cons:-Game has a lot of potential, Devs refuse to maximize that potential.-No matter what the devs tell you about this being a PVE based game is a lie and focuses towards PVP, very hard to keep the loot you find without some Jacka** killing you on sight.-Large FPS drops in certain areas as well as FPS hickups (This happens even on high end computers). Large cities that require a lot of rendering have a lot of FPS drops Campos on v2 being one.-Leveling is fairly slow-This game is pretty hard to play without some sort of GC start up fund as a new player to Infestation. Which I recommend getting at least one of the GC packs otherwise you'll have a hard time with no items in your GI. (Overall isn't fair to have to purchase more to the game to actually enjoy it)-Little options to lower resolution on lower end PC's.-Lots of bugs the community constantly complains about, but never get fixed in patches until far later.-Loads of Punkbuster issues with this game, Some Kicks, Some Temperary false bans, Others like myself getting Computer freezes/Lockups where a hard reset will only work.-People Being Falsely banned. (Supposidly, which really I think is because they have Keyloggers on their PC's)-Development in this game is pretty slow.-Things being promised, but never happen.-Customer Support is god awefully slow.-Developers make up pity excuses, whether it's based on your ban, features, implementations, etc.-False Advertising.-Very limited Zombie Models. (After a while of seeing the same NPC's they get stale real quick)-Animations are very limited and lack (Melee weapons Especially, Same animation over and over)-Lot of Hackers in this game that  have one goal, to kill you unfairly and steal your items and sell their account with your items and many other peoples items for a real profit.Overall:This game has a lot of potential, why the devs hold back, will never know. This game is getting better, but very slowly. The biggest issue in this game are the FPS problems. Owning an Nvidia Geforce GTX 470 GPU and an i7 CPU I should not be getting 5-10 FPS in Large cities, something isn't right. I can't say the devs are a scam, otherwise they'd stop further development of this game, but still doesnt make up the excuse why it's so slow in development. So would I recommend to buy this game? No, however it is enjoyable at times, but with the bugs and issues this game has as well as in the company, a lot needs to be changed before I can give a better review. So I'd wait for a better outcome on this game to be honest, if it gets that far. Don't get me wrong I play this a lot based on hours as you can see, it's just those enjoyable moments as I was saying is why I still play, and the Loot hoarding which is a special feature to have a GI while no other game has done (Besides Nether, but Nether is just as worse as this game don't know why people recommend it over this game I've seen Youtube reviews of the game that were just, bad).

content:
Posted: February 28, 2014
												Well after months of playing the game and almost 1,600 cumulative hours (spanned over six accounts), and being very patient with the development of it - the last draw for me was the in-game lockboxes. Lockboxes are part of an integral part of the game in my opinion, especially if you're playing the game in PVE style, which is how I was playing the game with my family - hence the six accounts. The game has much potential for both PVP and PVE styles, and if you've followed the author's customer service track record, you'll find that they have no regard for their fan base - they claim otherwise. I submitted a ticket explaining my situation regarding a particular item (lockbox) that I've placed on my personal rented server ($50 month) of which I play the game in PVE with my friends and family. I personally stopped playing the game for a few weeks, but my wife and some friends have been playing on my private server continuously. Well, I came back in to find a wonderful surprise as I was looking for my 16 lockboxes I had left around the map weeks earlier. I could not find one single lockbox! I thought maybe because of my inactivity, the lockboxes might have been returned to my Global Inventory… nope, not the case.  Lockboxes can cost (at the author’s discretion), between 150 game credits up to (what I’ve seen) 750 game credits and I’ve got (had) a total of 21. My problem with the game is in the following; the authors can do changes to the game with little or no notice to the players, and if you try to look for help (as in their ingame experience) there is virtually none! You’ll find this a continuous problem with other players in their own forum. I’ll give you my own example: When you go and buy the lockboxes in their marketplace, there is no mention anywhere that the lockbox you are about to purchase can disappear if you place it in the map and leave it unattended for a period of time. Mind you, this information IS buried somewhere in their forum and you’re supposed to know that, because they make it a point when you first spawn in to figure these things out, and you’re an idiot for not doing so – as ArtemisKnives will let you know on his twitch.After 1,600 hours of ingame experience, I discovered that placed lockboxes do indeed disappear if you don’t access them in three weeks. You can be playing the game during that period, but if you don’t get your character to actually go to the place where you placed your lockbox and access the lockbox, it will disappear. Their reasoning behind this, so the map won’t be littered with lockboxes; makes very much sense in public servers, but remember I had these on my own private server, 6-10 people max. Anyhow, I found this out the hard way, not through ingame instructions or easily found on their forum, but after 1600 ingame hours later.I submitted the following ticket to get some help (I just about laughed myself to tears when I got their answer three days later) can anyone say automated?:My request ticket Feb 15 23:15"I came back into the game today after a months hiatus, I checked my private server's expiration time and I had 11 days left. So I just dropped another $50 to renew for another month in fear that I would lose my lockboxes and so that my wife could continue playing as well (we only PVE on this game).Anyhow, my heart dropped when I found all my lockboxes gone filled with my gear and survival items I've gathered over time for RPG'ng with my family (yes they have accounts and we play together on private). I really don't know what to do with this game, I had over 21 lockboxes distributed with my wife's, and rpg accounts. I only have two left. I have spent some considerable money on these and I don't care about the items in them, but I would like the boxes back, please help!"Their answerScarlet (Infestation Survivor Support)Feb 18 17:01"Hello Survivor,Thank you for contacting Infestation customer support!For lockbox issues, please ensure that you are on the correct server and location that you have placed your lockbox. When a lockbox is placed, it can only be accessed from the specific server it is placed on. We recommend always writing a note for yourself detailing the server and location you have placed a lockbox, as well as the password, as it is the responsibility of each player to keep track of their lockbox and password. Additionally, please keep in mind that lockboxes will despawn after three weeks if items are not taken from or added to the lockbox.Please also be aware that recently particularly crafty players have taken up safe-cracking to get at the loot stored inside, so you will want to make sure to select more difficult passwords and transport your favorite items to your GI for safe keeping!While you will not be receiving any reimbursement regarding this issue, we do apologize for the inconvenience and want to let you know that fortunately all items can be found in-game.Also, you can check out our forums (http://forums.infestationmmo.com/) for tips on finding items you may have lost, as well as our Twitter Page (https://twitter.com/infestationmmo) and our Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/Infestationmmo) for future promotions and giveaways.We hope you have found this helpful and if you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit a new ticket and we will get back to you as soon as possible.Sincerely,Infestation Customer Support"In conclusion, if you want to throw your money at someone with terrible customer service, I totally recommend this game!

content:
Posted: December 30, 2013
												Poor game, worst development team I have ever encountered, even worse PR and a hell of a lot of lies. Pulled from Steam the same day it came to Steam. The hasn't been a lot of change to the game. Still feels like a mod of War Inc.Sergey Titov had a hand in this game who was also invovled in Big Rigs. So that say a lot about Infestation. If you don't know Big Rigs: Over The Road Racing. Look it up.The first time I heard about this game I was given the impression of a watered down DayZ.But even now through all the trouble the team is still slacking. I heard about a server in this game which was moded to bring some of the things that Hammerpoint promised such as cars. That was about a year ago now and Hammerpoint have only got around to testing cars now.This game maybe only £5.49 but you will get more value you out of burning your money I'd hate to say. It doesn't stop there the is also Microtransactions.Hackers, poor community, awful support and generally they want to take your money.Microtransaction are pretty much needed since you will quickly die by zombies. Although they shamble you sprint at a walking pace and jog at a snails pace. If you plan to fight the zombies you will either die of laughter by the horrible animations of when you hit them with your flashlight or die of boredom due to it taking so long.I won't lie it took me about 5-8 minutes of hitting a zombie over and over again.I suggest you save your money and look else where. The are other better games that do a similar job to Infestation.DayZState of DecayProject ZomboidThe Dead LingerI'm sure if you look around you will find something that will do the job.
