content:
Posted: April 25, 2014
												This game is only recommended if you are willing to demote time to it, if not don't bother buying it. It's not the worse game, but certainly not the best. I recommend learning from youtube and experienced players on Twitch.tv as this game doesn't have a tutorial for new players which is one of the worse things I've found. Hackers are not much of an issue as hacks are getting detected faster, compared to earlier versions. The developers are still adding more stuff to this game and modifying it every few weeks to provide a better experience for players which varies from stat changing of items and adding new things in such as Super Zombies (beware) that are a lot stronger but drop loot such as rare assault rifles and sniper rifles. Due to the recent price change, it's more reasonable to get this decent quality game at such a low price. This game is mainly PvP based aswell, very few private servers provide PvE with enforcement of the rule, which isn't necessarily a bad thing but makes somethings a lot easier and more fun so it's best to travel in a group (only with friends, as randoms will just get your location and kill you)Pros:-Multiple spawn points to prevent risk of spawn killing along with spawn protection-Looting for meds, food, or weapons is easier than before-Vehicles have been added for faster transportation-Large map to get loot and stay away from players-Variety of servers for players who perfer small servers or very populated ones-Safe zones are found throughout the map to allow players to store items and prevent loss of them-Zombies can drop up to $10,000 (very rare) but they drop $25-$50 almost every drop, which can be used in the store at safe zones and can be farmed very easily-Developers have made a youtube page to help out players with tips (players have some too)Cons:-Hackers are commonly found on official servers-Good weapons are found at places with super zombies or cities with mass pvp-Super Zombies are nearly impossible to kill if you're new (they die easily from semi-auto shotguns)-Vehicles are destroyed easily as physics don't include a form of suspension (roads lead to cities but none of them can be drove through as vehicles and other debris that prevent you from going through them)-Players have a 95 percent chance of killing you if you encounter them (there are ways of getting out of these situations)-It's very hard to start from scratch if you're new to this game (recommend playing in a group)-Players in vehicles can instantly kill you if you're not in a safezone7/10

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 12, 2014
												Zombie survival games, to be realistic and for it to work in some way, has to exist in either a single player story mode like crysis1 or at most some sort of co-op. It needs to have an end and a beginning. It doesn't need a scripted story. Just tell the players that the goal is somewhere way yonder and how they get to it, is the story.The openworld can be like in this game, you can have bandits or npc turned bandit randomly depending on your circumstances. Foodstuff should be finite and so should other supllies. You can't have bandits waiting at edges of your spawn point or areas where you can or cannot shoot. You cannot have 15 people coming back to the same place for the same loot that respawns after a given time, that's not realistic.For this openworld zombie game thing to work, everything in it has to be finite. Because that's how you see it in all the movies and that's how people want to play it. Rick doesn't shoot Glen the first time they meet, normal people trying to survive don't do that. Zombies themselves should be finite since they once were people. Remember Dawn of the dead? Stuck in a mall but in the end things run out, so you gotta leave anyway. Imagine a game that you can play like in the movie I am Legend. You'd never finish the game though but would have to go further to find supplies everyday. You could play it for a month and not finish.That's why mmo zombie games will never work. Just make a game that takes 120 hours to complete on easy. Like GTA but zombified. The people who make such a game would become legends.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2013
												The game in itself is not horrible, but it's still pretty bad. The trailers and screenshots are edited to make the game look nice. Half the time the game is glitched or broken, and the world is full of hackers and spawncampers. The game is full of microtransactions which can all be lost seconds after outfitting your character to some random person who found a gun. There hasn't been a real update since the games release, and the developers are obviously just taking what money they can from a broken game and running away with it. Overall, the only good thing about this game is that the few times it does work, it's like a seriously downgraded DayZ. 2/10, would not reccomend to anyone.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 30, 2013
												A definite, DO NOT BUY! (IMO)It's "The WarZ" (Not the Movie) under a different name.It's faster paced than DayZ-Mod for sure,but a lot smaller, world wise, amount of zombies (/1) and players per server.It also got the silly 3rd Person (/3rd) camera and most zombies can be avoidedby crawling around like in the DayZ-Mod.The game being smaller, also enables most combat being in close or medium range,which isn't necesseraly bad.Additionaly you can only get knee deep into the water and then there is a invisible wall which won't let you swim.Then there is the ambience noise and music, as soon you get closer to buildings/settlements or just at random, horrormovie ambience comes out of nowhere (/A), the normal ingame-music contains zombie moans(WHY?) the regular music can be disabled in the settings.It's pretty much a FFA/DM (/2) with zombies and a bit of survival (/3) and rpg (/4) elements,other survivors are the biggest and most occuring threat.Zombies ain't much of a threat to the player unless you let them to close, great thing about the zombies is that you can Outrun them, but watch out, they don't tire, unlike you...For killing zombies silenced firearms or a sturdy melee weapons is adviseable, aim high to hit the head.Then there is an online shop, where you can buy everything from water and painkillers over backpacks and clothes to firearms and ammunition, for actual money and ingame currency, you also can lose these items when you get killed or you drop (DUH!) them.Some firearms can be modified with various attachments, which also can be bought or found.This software also has a big issue with "hackers" (/H), like the DayZ-Mod due to the communication architecture in between client and server, most things are calculated and rendered by the client, the server is pretty much just there to synchronize the data send by the clients, which makes games very prone to be manipulated.########### Bottom Notes ###########(1) The screenshots with hundreds of zombies are fake in the aspect that just for the sole purpose of the screenshot, additional zombies were spawned in by admins, you'll never encounter that many zombies.(3rd) In my honest opinion, third-person doesn't belong in games like this, it's silly to me.        You either design a game in fhird(Good example, Warframe) or first person, if you do both,        server should enforce one of those perspectives, third-person is just usable to look around        corners and covers, it's not really feasable in combat in this game unlike DayZ-Mod where        third-person combat is very feasable and still annoying to me.(A)    Random piano strokes, this eery intensifying noise when something bad is about to happen,        like the murderer sneaks up to the victim, and that "whom"noise that occurs in movies when a         character suddenly has the monster in his/hers very face.(2)    FFA (Free for All) and DM (Death Match) which are identical. (3)    Food, Drinks, Bandages, First-Aid-Kits, etc.(4)    Skills like longer sprint time, faster reload, faster bandaging, damage reduction, etc.(H)    This is just here to not name those who use script/hack-tools in a game, hackers.        You don't call criminals, Gun-Knive-Weapon_Smithers-Manufacturers-Maker.        The people using the hacks are just using tools and scripts,        made by real hackes who actually put a lot of effort in their products, their motivation,        ranges from boredom over to challange and then to sabotage the product or/and community,        some do it just because they can or maybe even profit.

												Its seriously not as bad as people make it out to be. The only reason this game gets a bad rep is because total biscuit made a negative review about it during the ALPHA stage and his fanbois must spread his opinion as if it is their own. I almost didnt buy the game because of negative reviews but i am glad it didnt stop me. The game is really quite fun and very populated. Yes it does have an ingame cash shop but its kind of ironic in that people go spend a bunch of money and you kill them with a pistol you found and take it all.This was the first DayZ clone (that i know of) The first clone games always get a bad rep, and with a popular negative video review on top of that it just makes people get off on putting down on this game. Its stupid really.Overall, if you like zombie survival, open world pvp, and full loot type games, this is up your alley.

												Pros -1) Huge open world2) The Metascore doesn't lie, it really is worth 20/100Cons -1) Because the world is so big, it takes you hours to travel from one side of the map to the other...2) DayZ rip-off3) Hackers4) You have to pay to revive your character if they die, or you have to wait 24 hours to start playing again..5) You'll likely get killed within 20 minutes. Whether it be laggy zombies killing you, or other players who shoot on sight6) Doesn't look anything like in the screenshots7) You have to pay for literally everything, because you can't fight for sh*t with the flashlight you get, and finding a good weapon is very hard.

												Don't waste your money. This game used to be called The War Z, and recieved such bad reviews and bad press that the developers changed the name and went back to steam. For some reason Valve hasn't removed these scammers from their storefront, and refused to give me a refund despite the blatant false advertisementes all over there store page. Don't waste your money.

												This game is complete trash, do not even consider it.  And the metacritic score is 20, which is the lowest I have seen for any game ever.  I cant even get into a server, and when I do, the game feels like Team Deathmatch instead of trying to survive.  The zombie animations are also really really bad and they sound terrible.
